response.overview: The documentary tells about the rights violations experienced by mothers and children in prisons in Turkey, who are forced to stay with their mothers in prisons for children aged 0-6, their traumas after prison, and the effects they have on children. According to the European juvenile conventions and the Turkish constitution, children between the ages of 0-6 should not go to prison with their mothers. Rezan ZUĞURLİ ATAŞ, who was the youngest and most voted mayor of Turkey in the 2014 elections, was imprisoned because of his political views, along with his one-year-old child, through the eyes of a mother, the rights violations and unlawfulness they experienced in prison, and the effects it left on children aged 0-6. documentary film that conveys the effects to the audience with the narration of the expert psychologist and the mother.
response.title: Being a Mother in Prison
